Job Title: Audio Engineer

Location: Salt Lake City, UT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
The salary range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs.

At WGU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is:

Pay Range: $63,800.00 - $95,700.00

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.

Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities: 

Operate and maintain audio equipment, including mixing consoles, microphones, communications systems, recorders, and audio playback systems.Set up and calibrate audio systems in various settings, ensuring optimal sound quality and appropriate volume levels.Mix and balance audio elements in real-time during broadcasts and live events, adjusting as needed to achieve the best audio quality.Collaborate closely with producers, directors, presenters, and technical crew to understand sound requirements and artistic visions.Monitor audio levels, troubleshoot issues, and address technical glitches swiftly to minimize disruptions.Coordinate with the technical team to integrate audio with lighting, video, and other production elements seamlessly.Implement sound effects, music cues, and other audio elements as required by the production.Manage audio recordings for archiving and post-production purposes.Stay up to date with industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in audio engineering and sound design.Performs other related duties as assigned. 

Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:

Profound knowledge of audio engineering principles, microphone pickup patterns, signal flow, acoustics, routing, and sound reinforcement techniques.Expertise in operating professional audio equipment, including mixing consoles, microphones, processors, and speakers.Strong understanding of broadcast protocols, live event dynamics, and the unique challenges associated with each.Proficiency in audio editing software and digital audio workstations for post-production tasks.Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with diverse teams and convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Capacity to maintain Audio equipment in a clean & organized manner.Ability to work efficiently under pressure and adapt to dynamic, fast-paced environments.Creative flair for enhancing audio experiences, creating immersive soundscapes, sound effects, foley, and employing innovative techniques.Proficiency in industry-standard audio software and hardware including Dante Audio, Adobe Audition, Waves Plug-Ins, and ProTools.Strong Understanding of audio compression, equalization, and loudness normalization for location, broadcast, and post-production audio.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues effectively.

Competencies: 

Organizational Impact:

Works to achieve operational targets within job areas impacting department, function, or office results. Work is performed independently on moderately complex projects and assignments with some guidance required for direction and complex tasks. Sets objectives for oneself to meet the goals of projects or assignments. 

Problem Solving & Decision Making:

Responsible for employing adjustments or recommended enhancements to systems and processes to solve problems or improve the job area’s effectiveness while leveraging a systems-thinking approach. Problems faced may require an understanding of a broader set of issues and job areas. 

Communication & Influence:

Collaborates with contacts typically within the job area to obtain or provide information requiring some explanation or interpretation. 

Leadership & Talent Management

May provide guidance and assistance to entry-level professionals and or support employees. Demonstrates the WGU leadership principles in all aspects of service to students, employees, and partners of WGU. 

Job Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Audio Engineering, Sound Design, or a related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.3+ years of professional experience in audio engineering, with a demonstrated focus on broadcast and live event sound mixing.Familiarity with Blackmagic brand broadcast and live-production equipment.Familiarity with safety protocols and regulations related to audio equipment and event setups.

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Physical capability to lift and transport audio equipment as required. Up to 50 lbs. at times.Flexibility to work irregular hours, including some evenings and weekends, based on production schedules.Ability to travel to production locations with some out of state travel.

As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
